subject: Gardening
title: Fin Garden: Persia's Oldest
description: A quick, practical guide to Fin Garden: Persia's Oldest.

hook.text: Iran's Fin Garden has survived earthquakes, wars, and regime changes for over 500 years. It still flows.

buildup.text: Built in Kashan, Fin Garden channels water from a hillside spring through turquoise-tiled pools and channels.

discovery.text: The garden follows the classic chahar baghâ€”four-part design symbolizing the four rivers of paradise.

twist.text: In 1852, Iran's reformist prime minister was assassinated in Fin Garden's bathhouse. Beauty witnessed brutality.

climax.text: Fin Garden endures as both a UNESCO site and a living symbol of Persian civilization's deep bond with water.

quiz.question: What historical event darkened Fin Garden's history?
options: A massive earthquake destroyed half the garden in 1700
Iran's reformist prime minister was assassinated in its bathhouse in 1852
Foreign invaders used it as a military camp during WWI
